title: Sergio Ramos Names The Player He Looked Up To Most
text:
Sergio Ramos Names The Player He Looked Up To Most Sat Feb 18 2017 20:56:25   20:56:25 GMT+0000 (GMT) Ryan Sidle Ryan Sidle in football 
During his time at the Bernabeu Sergio Ramos has become a Real Madrid legend in his own right. But as a youngster he looked up to a fellow legend but in a very different position. 
It's crazy to think that Ramos didn't start life with Real considering how synonymous he's become with the club since joining them 12 years ago. 
The defender started life at Sevilla, playing two seasons for the La Liga club, before moving to the Bernabeu aged 19. 
Since then he's had an incredible career winning three league titles and two Champions Leagues, making a telling contribution in both finals. 
Speaking in a Q&A Ramos revealed his footballing hero was a former Real Madrid star but a striker in the form of Ronaldo: 
"When I started out I was more a fan of attacking players and one in particular, the Brazilian Ronaldo. " 
Considering his penchant for late goals, and the fact that he's got six league goals in 13 starts this season, it's not actually that surprising that Ramos loved a striker. 
And Ronaldo wasn't the only one either. Ramos also admitted to looking up to former Rangers and Argentina striker Claudio Caniggia, partially for a very different reason: 
"Another of my idols was Claudio Caniggia, an Argentine forward with long hair whom I liked a lot. 
"It's because of him I started to grow my hair long."
